snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include the banning of a free call and text service used by migrant workers in Saudi Arabia and the growing...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Thursday, selections include the banning of a free call and text service used by migrant workers in Saudi Arabia and the growing technological community in New Orleans in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Banned in Saudi Arabia and Building a 'Silicon Bayou'
